intro: Ixia maculata var. ochroleuca, commonly known as the Orange-veined Ixia, is a striking bulbous plant native to South Africa. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically orange with contrasting white or yellow veins. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are usually dark green with a reddish tint. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
